thread.title: 7 Must To See Tourist Attractions In Munich Germany
thread.title_full: 7 Must To See Tourist Attractions In Munich Germany

author: admin
title: 7 Must To See Tourist Attractions In Munich Germany
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > 7 Must To See Tourist Attractions In Munich Germany 7 Must To See Tourist Attractions In Munich Germany By admin on July 13, 2015 Pin It 
Munich with 1.4 million residents is one of the most favorite cities for visitors to Germany. The city is a marvelous blend of modern and traditional exclusive cultural offerings, buoyant economy, esteemed department stores, quality-based sports facilities, friendly people, world-class occurrences and first-class leisure activities. 
Munich is also a tourist spot in Germany and has all reasons to boast consisting of some of the best tourist attractions in the world. This city is growing in popularity because of its lively atmosphere and because of its attractions. Top Tourist Attractions In Munich Germany 
Some of the most worth-visiting tourist attractions in Munich Germany include: Marienplatz – New Town Hall and Marien Square 
Marienplatz is Central Square in Munich and this is a place from where you get the scope of exploring many wonderful and old buildings, landmarks and churches. 
Marienplatz accommodates Marian Column and Mariensaule and it also serves as a home to the New and the Old Town hall of Munich. Frauenkirche – Cathedral of Our Blessed Lady 
Frauenkirche is Munich’s landmark as it is the largest church in the city. The church has the capacity of holding more than 20,000 people. The church has been built in 15trh century Gothic style architecture. Nymphenburg Palace 
Nymphenburg Palace owes its origin to Max Emanuel’s birth. Max Emanuel was the son and the heir to Electro Ferdinand Maria. This is a cube-shaped palace that served as the summer residence for the Wittelsbach rulers. Deutsches Museum 
Deutsches Museum is also called the German Museum of Masterpieces of Technology and Science. The museum opened in the year 1925 and it serves as the perfect place for people who are interested in science. It is truly one of the best tourist attractions in Munich Germany. Dachau Concentration Camp 
Dachau Concentration Camp lies 10 miles towards the northwestern part of Munich and it was the very first concentration camp in Nazi Germany. It served in the form of a model for the other concentration camps in Third Reich. BMW Headquarters 
The BMW headquarters is one of the important landmarks of Munich, which is also known as BMW Towers, BMW four-cylinders, or BMW Hochhaus. 
It is actually the world headquarters of BMW. This 331ft long building is one of the best examples for wonderful architectural building of Munich, which is located near Olympic Village. Allianz Arena 
This is too an important landmark of Munich, which you should not miss during your visit. This is a football stadium with a seating capacity of 75,024. 
But, if you are thinking of visiting it, then you need to visit it during nighttime to see its specialty. This is the first stadium in the world in which the exterior changes color.
